thread.title: Farragut bests Bearden again for region volleyball title - PrepXtra
thread.title_full: Farragut bests Bearden again for region volleyball title - PrepXtra Story

author: Mike Blackerby
title: Farragut bests Bearden again for region volleyball title - PrepXtra
text:
CLINTON â€” Farragut High School still has Bearden's number in the Region 2-AAA volleyball tournament.
The teams met for the tournament championship for the fifth consecutive year Tuesday night at Anderson County, with the Lady Admirals walking away with their fourth region title in a row.
Led by hard-hitting tournament MVP Alexis Parker, Farragut started strong and weathered a late Bearden rally to win 25-9, 25-16, 23-25, 25-18.
"We were all just ready to play," said Parker, who had 23 kills, four digs and three blocks.
"We've had a little break since district, and everybody was on fire tonight. It (winning the region) is a big deal. You have to get through district teams like Hardin Valley and Bearden, who are big rivals."
Both Farragut and Bearden advance to Thursday's state sectionals at 7 p.m. The Lady Admirals host Region 1 runner-up Morristown West while Bearden travels to Region 1 champion Tennessee High.
Farragut coach Susan Davidson said Parker gave her team a big spark early with her power game at the net.
"Alexis is just a special athlete," Davidson said.
"She has just got a really strong arm and she is so well-poised."
Mikaela Brock added 22 digs for the Lady Admirals.
"Mikaela did a super job passing tonight," Davidson said.
Shelby Grace Rawls contributed six blocks and four kills, Sydney Cherney had 14 assists and three blocks and Caroline Bower had four kills and five blocks for Farragut.
Davidson also lauded the play of Anne Abernathy (10 kills, four blocks).
"She gave us a big spark in the fourth set," Davidson said.
Both teams swept three-game matches earlier Tuesday night in the semifinals to advance to the championship.
Farragut eliminated Oak Ridge 25-17, 25-11, 25-12 and Bearden topped host Anderson County 25-23, 25-11, 25-22.
The Lady Admirals, who suffered key losses to graduation after advancing to the state championship game a year ago and losing to Brentwood, are just one win from returning to the state tournament.
"After we left Murfreesboro last year, we were hungry," Davidson said.
"We have been blessed with our upperclassmen and seniors, and our freshmen have risen to the occasion."
Mike Blackerby is a freelance contributor.
